definition: surname Di/variant of 狄[Di2], generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
original name of Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3]
Herbert Allen Giles (1845-1935), British diplomat and linguist, contributor to the Wade-Giles Chinese romanization system

sentences.english: You need to be tough to survive the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 要在翟林中活下赖就要有坚忍不跋的鱼志。

sentences.english: Fellow astronaut Liu Boming also emerged briefly from the capsule to hand Zhai the Chinese flag.
sentences.chinese: 他的同事刘伯明也从太空舱短暂探出来把旗子递给翟。

sentences.english: Zhai, the professor quoted by Xinhua, said he knows Wang and Cai's paper.
sentences.chinese: 新华社援引翟教授说法，他知道王和蔡的文章。

sentences.english: Secondly, I will discuss the role and value of Anti-Fatalism in Mozi's ideology.
sentences.chinese: 接著，探讨非命在墨翟思想体系具有的地位与价值。

sentences.english: Guidance eof new users should not stop once they've registered.
sentences.chinese: 对新用户提供的指引翟信息不应在他们注册后就停止。

definition: barley/to moo/to seek or obtain/old variant of 侔[mou2]/old variant of 眸[mou2]
surname Yin/dynasty name at the end the Shang dynasty, after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
surname Lou/one of the 28 lunar mansions in Chinese astronomy
first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
pitchpipe, pitch standard, one of the twelve semitones in the traditional tone system
surname Pan/Pan, faun in Greek mythology, son of Hermes
